t: Jeremiah 6
Impending Destruction from the North

“O*pn you children of Benjamin, Gather*ld yourselves to flee from the midst of Jerusalem! Blow*ld the trumpet in Tekoa, And*ld set up a signal-fire in Beth Haccerem; For*ld disaster appears out of the north, And*ld great destruction.
I*ld have likened the daughter of Zion To*ld a lovely and delicate woman.
The*ld shepherds with their flocks shall come to her. They*ld shall pitch their*i tents against her all around. Each*ld one shall pasture in his own place.”
“Prepare*ln war against her; Arise,*ld and let us go up at noon. Woe*ld to us, for the day goes away, For*ld the shadows of the evening are lengthening.
Arise,*ld and let us go by night, And*ld let us destroy her palaces.”
For*p thus has the Lord*s of hosts said: “Cut*pn down trees, And*ld build a mound against Jerusalem. This*ld is*i the city to be punished. She*ld is*i full of oppression in her midst.
As*ld a fountain wells up with water, So*ld she wells up with her wickedness. Violence*ld and plundering are heard in her. Before*ld Me continually are*i grief and wounds.
Be*ld instructed, O Jerusalem, Lest*ld My soul depart from you; Lest*ld I make you desolate, A*ld land not inhabited.”
Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: “They*pn shall thoroughly glean as a vine the remnant of Israel; As*ld a grape-gatherer, put your hand back into the branches.”

To*ln whom shall I speak and give warning, That*ld they may hear? Indeed*ld their ear is*i uncircumcised, And*ld they cannot give heed. Behold,*ld the word of the Lord*s is a reproach to them; They*ld have no delight in it.

Therefore*ld I am full of the fury of the Lord.*s I*ld am weary of holding it*i in. “I*ld will pour it out on the children outside, And*ld on the assembly of young men together; For*ld even the husband shall be taken with the wife, The*ld aged with him*i who*i is*i full of days.
And*ld their houses shall be turned over to others, Fields*ld and wives together; For*ld I will stretch out My hand Against*ld the inhabitants of the land,” says the Lord.*s
“Because*ld from the least of them even to the greatest of them, Everyone*ld is*i given to covetousness; And*ld from the prophet even to the priest, Everyone*ld deals falsely.
They*ld have also healed the hurt of My people slightly, Saying,*ld ‘Peace, peace!’ When*ld there*i is*i no peace.

Were*ld they ashamed when they had committed abomination? No!*ld They were not at all ashamed; Nor*ld did they know how to blush. Therefore*ld they shall fall among those who fall; At*ld the time I punish them, They*ld shall be cast down,” says the Lord.*s

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Stand*pn in the ways and see, And*ld ask for the old paths, where the good way is,*i And*ld walk in it; Then*ld you will find rest for your souls. But*ld they said, ‘We will not walk in*i it.’*i
Also,*ld I set watchmen over you, saying,*i ‘Listen*ld to the sound of the trumpet!’ But*ld they said, ‘We will not listen.’
Therefore*ld hear, you nations, And*ld know, O congregation, what is*i among them.
Hear,*ld O earth! Behold,*ld I will certainly bring calamity on this people— The*ld fruit of their thoughts, Because*ld they have not heeded My words Nor*ld My law, but rejected it.
For*ld what purpose to Me Comes*ld frankincense from Sheba, And*ld sweet cane from a far country? Your*ld burnt offerings are*i not acceptable, Nor*ld your sacrifices sweet to Me.”

Therefore*p thus says the Lord:*s “Behold,*pn I will lay stumbling blocks before this people, And*ld the fathers and the sons together shall fall on them. The*ld neighbor and his friend shall perish.”
Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Behold,*pn a people comes from the north country, And*ld a great nation will be raised from the farthest parts of the earth.

They*ld will lay hold on bow and spear; They*ld are*i cruel and have no mercy; Their*ld voice roars like the sea; And*ld they ride on horses, As*ld men of war set in array against you, O daughter of Zion.”
We*ln have heard the report of it; Our*ld hands grow feeble. Anguish*ld has taken hold of us, Pain*ld as of a woman in labor.
Do*ld not go out into the field, Nor*ld walk by the way. Because*ld of the sword of the enemy, Fear*ld is*i on every side.
O*ld daughter of my people, Dress*ld in sackcloth And*ld roll about in ashes! Make*ld mourning as*i for*i an only son, most bitter lamentation; For*ld the plunderer will suddenly come upon us.
“I*ln have set you as*i an assayer and*i a fortress among My people, That*ld you may know and test their way.
They*ld are*i all stubborn rebels, walking as slanderers. They*ild are*i bronze and iron, They*ld are*i all corrupters;
The*ld bellows blow fiercely, The*ld lead is consumed by the fire; The*ld smelter refines in vain, For*ld the wicked are not drawn off.
People*ild will call them rejected silver, Because*ld the Lord*s has rejected them.”
